segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to another podcast here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一期播客。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we have a fun dialogue.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一个有趣的对话。

segments.en: That's right.
Well, maybe the language in this lesson you won't use every day, but it's fun, it's interesting, and it's a little bit on the lighter side.
segments.cn: 也许这节课的语言你不会每天使用，但它有趣、轻松。

segments.en: That's right.
Today we're going to be looking at baby talk, so we're going to see some of these words that aren't really words.
segments.cn: 今天我们要讨论婴儿语言，所以我们会看到一些并不是真正单词的词汇。

segments.en: They're not real words that you can find in the dictionary, but native English speakers use them when they're talking to little babies.
segments.cn: 这些不是字典里的真实单词，但母语为英语的人在和小宝宝说话时会用到。

segments.en: Yeah, in many languages there's a rule for how you make baby talk words, right?
segments.cn: 是的，很多语言都有关于如何构造婴儿语言的规则，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
But in English we don't have really clear rules about how you make a word a baby word, so we're going to teach you a few of these baby words.
segments.cn: 但在英语中，我们没有明确的规则来将一个词变成婴儿词，所以我们将教你一些婴儿词。

segments.en: Exactly.
So before we listen to the dialogue, why don't we take a look at vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 在我们听对话之前，先来看看词汇预览。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
Okay, we have two words here we're going to hear in the dialogue, and the first one is diaper.
segments.cn: 好的，我们这里有两个词将在对话中出现，第一个是尿布。

segments.en: Diaper.
Diaper.
Okay, so a diaper, a baby uses a diaper.
segments.cn: 好的，尿布是婴儿使用的。

segments.en: That's right.
It's a piece of cloth or material that you put around the baby so that it can go to the bathroom and not make a mess.
segments.cn: 这是一块布或材料，包裹在婴儿身上，以便他们可以上厕所而不弄得一团糟。

segments.en: Okay, a diaper.
Now we also have another word that we commonly use in the English language, it's Nana.
segments.cn: 现在我们还有另一个在英语中常用的词，是Nana。

segments.en: Nana.
Nana.
So Nana is the name we call a grandmother.
segments.cn: Nana是我们称呼祖母的名字。

segments.en: Right, so an informal name, just like in Spanish we would say something like abue or abuelita.
segments.cn: 对，所以这是一个非正式的称呼，就像在西班牙语中我们会说abue或abuelita。

segments.en: Or in Italian you might say oma.
segments.cn: 或者在意大利语中你可能会说oma。

segments.en: This is another way that we can call grandma or granny.
segments.cn: 这是我们称呼奶奶或外婆的另一种方式。

segments.en: Nana.
Okay, so Nana.
Why don't we listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 我们来第一次听对话吧。

segments.en: Let's see how these new parents are talking to their little baby using baby talk.
segments.cn: 让我们看看这些新父母是如何用婴儿语言和他们的小宝宝交流的。

segments.en: Honey, the baby's up again.
It's your turn.
I see.
You made a doo doo.
What's going on hun?
Why is the baby crying?
The little baby made a doo doo.
What a good boy.
Let's get this icky diaper off you.
segments.cn: 让我们把这个脏尿布换掉。

segments.en: Look at what I have here.
Mickey Mouse jammies.
Whoopsie Daisy.
Did the little baby just tinkle all over daddy?
segments.cn: 小宝宝刚刚在爸爸身上尿尿了吗？

segments.en: Yes he did.
Yes he did.
You just made a wee wee all over daddy.
segments.cn: 你刚刚在爸爸身上尿尿了。

segments.en: Hold still while I change his yucky diaper.
segments.cn: 在我给他换掉这个脏尿布时，别动。

segments.en: What's going on in here?
Oh look it's Nana.
Say hi to Nana.
He's so adorable.
I could just eat him up.
Okay, say bye to Nana.
Time to go beddy-bye.
Okay well that was pretty cute wasn't it?
segments.cn: 好吧，那真是太可爱了，不是吗？

segments.en: A cute dialogue.
The baby seemed to be cute and well everyone's excited about the new baby.
segments.cn: 宝宝看起来很可爱，大家都对新宝宝感到兴奋。

segments.en: Mm -hmm but they use some really interesting little words that are pretty unfamiliar so let's look at them now in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 嗯-嗯，但他们使用了一些非常有趣的小词汇，这些词汇相当陌生，所以让我们现在在语言总结中看看它们。

segments.en: Alright so as we mentioned before these words aren't actually words that you won't find them in the dictionary.
segments.cn: 好吧，正如我们之前提到的，这些词实际上并不是你在字典中能找到的单词。

segments.en: Right but you'll hear them commonly when people are talking to babies and you might see them in a movie or something like that so why don't we get started with the first one.
segments.cn: 对，但你会在与婴儿交谈时常常听到它们，或者在电影中看到它们，所以我们先从第一个开始吧。

segments.en: Alright the first word that may seem a little bit strange the father said hello whittle baby.
segments.cn: 好吧，第一个词可能看起来有点奇怪，父亲说你好，小宝宝。

segments.en: Whittle baby.
Okay whittle.
So whittle is just a baby talk way of saying little.
segments.cn: 所以小是婴儿语言中表示小的方式。

segments.en: Little that's right.
Now the father saw that the baby was crying because he made a doo-doo.
segments.cn: 现在父亲看到宝宝在哭，因为他做了个便便。

segments.en: The baby made the doo-doo not the father.
segments.cn: 是宝宝做的便便，而不是父亲。

segments.en: Right the baby made a doo-doo.
Mm-hmm a doo-doo.
Okay so basically a doo-doo is when the baby poos or poops in the diaper.
segments.cn: 好的，便便基本上是指宝宝在尿布里排便。

segments.en: Okay so you know sometimes you go to the bathroom and it might take a little bit longer.
segments.cn: 好的，有时你去洗手间可能会花一点时间。

segments.en: Exactly.
That's because of the doo-doo.
The doo-doo.
Alright the actual technical or maybe the proper English word for this would be defecate.
segments.cn: 好吧，实际的技术性或许是正确的英语词是排便。

segments.en: Okay so make a doo-doo.
Alright now our third words are interesting because he said icky diaper.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们的第三个词很有趣，因为他说脏尿布。

segments.en: That's right an icky diaper.
And then he also said yucky.
So we've got two words here that mean the same thing icky and yucky.
segments.cn: 所以我们这里有两个意思相同的词，脏和恶心。

segments.en: Mm-hmm and basically means disgusting.
segments.cn: 嗯-嗯，基本上是指令人厌恶的。

segments.en: Right something that's really really not nice.
segments.cn: 对，指的是非常不好的东西。

segments.en: So you would say icky or yucky.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说脏或恶心。

segments.en: Now these words have other similar words we might recognize ick or yuck.
segments.cn: 现在这些词还有其他类似的词我们可能会认出，像是呕或恶心。

segments.en: Right so you would use ick or yuck if something is disgusting but when you're kind of talking to a baby you would say icky yucky smelly.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果某样东西令人厌恶，你会用呕或恶心，但当你和婴儿说话时，你会说脏、恶心、臭。

segments.en: The adjective.
Now our next word the the father said he has some Mickey Mouse jammies.
segments.cn: 现在我们的下一个词，父亲说他有米老鼠睡衣。

segments.en: Jammies.
Jammies.
Okay so what are jammies?
Well the word jammies is short for pajamas.
Okay pajamas so the clothes that you put on when you go to sleep.
segments.cn: 好的，睡衣就是你睡觉时穿的衣服。

segments.en: Mm-hmm jammies.
Jammies.
Alright and now for our last two words they mean the same thing as well.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们的最后两个词也有相同的意思。

segments.en: The little baby tinkled all over daddy.
segments.cn: 小宝宝在爸爸身上尿尿了。

segments.en: So to tinkle.
And then his mom said a wee wee all over daddy.
segments.cn: 然后他的妈妈说在爸爸身上小便了。

segments.en: You made a wee wee.
Okay so tinkle and wee wee.
Basically also going to the bathroom but this time to pee.
segments.cn: 基本上也是上厕所，但这次是尿尿。

segments.en: To pee exactly.
To urinate.
Mm -hmm wee wee.
So the verb to tinkle and the noun a wee wee.
segments.cn: 所以动词尿尿和名词小便。

segments.en: Mm-hmm very good.
So these are the words that we have for you today in language.
segments.cn: 所以这些是我们今天为你准备的词汇。

segments.en: Take away as you can see they're kind of cute and very common when you're talking to babies and you know you have to be a little bit nicer.
segments.cn: 带走吧，正如你所见，它们有点可爱，在和宝宝说话时非常常见，你知道你得稍微温柔一点。

segments.en: Mm-hmm all right so why don't we listen to the dialogue another time a little bit slower and you'll catch these words a little bit easier.
segments.cn: 嗯嗯，好吧，那我们再听一遍对话，慢一点，你会更容易抓住这些词。

segments.en: Honey the baby's up again.
It's your turn I went last night.
Fine.
Hello little baby.
Why are you crying little baby?
Oh I see you made a doo-doo.
What's going on hun?
Why is the baby crying?
The little baby made a doo-doo.
What a good boy.
Let's get this icky diaper off you.
segments.cn: 让我们把这个脏尿布换掉。

segments.en: Look at what I have here.
Mickey Mouse jammies.
Whoopsie Daisy.
Did the little baby just tinkle all over daddy?
segments.cn: 小宝宝刚刚在爸爸身上尿尿了吗？

segments.en: Yes he did.
Yes he did.
You just made a wee wee all over daddy.
segments.cn: 你刚刚在爸爸身上尿尿了。

segments.en: Hold still while I change his yucky diaper.
segments.cn: 静止不动，我来换掉他脏脏的尿布。

segments.en: What's going on in here?
Oh look it's Nana.
Say hi to Nana.
Oh he's so adorable.
I could just eat him up.
Okay say bye to Nana.
Time to go beddy-bye.
Alright so now that we've seen those great words let's take a look at two phrases that we're gonna look at now in fluency builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们看到了这些很棒的词汇，让我们看看现在要在流利度提升中学习的两个短语。

segments.en: Fluency builder.
So the mother didn't really want to get up and look after the baby.
segments.cn: 所以妈妈其实不太想起床照顾宝宝。

segments.en: She said it's your turn.
It's your turn.
It's your turn.
So when she says it's your turn that means you should do it now.
segments.cn: 所以当她说轮到你了，这意味着你现在应该去做。

segments.en: Right so she's basically saying now you have to do it.
segments.cn: 对，所以她基本上是在说现在你得去做。

segments.en: I did it last time so now you have to do it.
segments.cn: 我上次做了，所以现在你得去做。

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
It's your turn.
That's right it's your turn.
And well the Nana, the grandmother, she was really... of course she really loves this little baby and she said I could just eat him up.
segments.cn: 而且奶奶，她真的...当然她非常爱这个小宝宝，她说我真想把他吃掉。

segments.en: I could just eat him up.
I could just eat him up.
Now does she want to really eat him?
segments.cn: 现在她真的想吃掉他吗？

segments.en: No of course, of course not.
So what does she mean by this?
segments.cn: 那她这句话是什么意思？

segments.en: This is a phrase we often use with very cute things.
segments.cn: 这是我们常用来形容非常可爱的东西的短语。

segments.en: It just means oh my god he's so cute.
segments.cn: 这只是意味着哦，我的天，他真可爱。

segments.en: Okay he's so cute that I wish I could just hug him and kiss him a lot.
segments.cn: 好吧，他太可爱了，我希望我能多抱抱他，亲亲他。

segments.en: Yes we might use this with babies or maybe with puppies.
segments.cn: 是的，我们可能会用这个来形容宝宝或小狗。

segments.en: I could just eat him up.
Alright so great two phrases that we've just taken a look at.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们刚刚看了两个很棒的短语。

segments.en: Let's go back to our dialogue for the last time and then we'll come back and talk a little bit more about these babies.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再回到我们的对话，然后我们再回来聊聊这些宝宝。

segments.en: Honey the baby's up again.
It's your turn.
I went last night.
Fine.
Hello little baby.
Why are you crying little baby?
Oh I see.
You made a doo doo.
What's going on hon?
Why is the baby crying?
The little baby made a doo doo.
What a good boy.
Let's get this icky diaper off you.
segments.cn: 让我们把这个脏尿布换掉。

segments.en: Look at what I have here.
Mickey Mouse jammies.
Whoopsie Daisy.
Did the little baby just tinkle all over daddy?
segments.cn: 小宝宝刚刚在爸爸身上尿尿了吗？

segments.en: Yes he did.
Yes he did.
You just made a wee wee all over daddy.
segments.cn: 你刚刚在爸爸身上尿尿了。

segments.en: Hold still while I change his yucky diaper.
segments.cn: 静止不动，我来换掉他脏脏的尿布。

segments.en: What's going on in here?
Oh look it's Nana.
Say hi to Nana.
He's so adorable.
I could just eat him up.
Okay say bye to Nana.
Time to go beddy-bye.
Okay so they are obviously new parents.
segments.cn: 好吧，他们显然是新父母。

segments.en: They've just had a baby so they're excited about him waking up and they're all excited about the baby and how he wakes up and everything.
segments.cn: 他们刚刚有了一个宝宝，所以他们对他醒来感到兴奋，他们都很兴奋宝宝醒来的一切。

segments.en: But an interesting thing the baby was sleeping in another room.
segments.cn: 但有趣的是，宝宝在另一个房间里睡觉。

segments.en: In English-speaking countries people have sort of two different opinions about how you should sleep with your baby.
segments.cn: 在讲英语的国家，人们对如何和宝宝一起睡有两种不同的看法。

segments.en: You know some people want to have the baby in the bed with them right?
segments.cn: 你知道，有些人想让宝宝和他们一起睡，对吧？

segments.en: But some people think no the baby should definitely sleep in its own room.
segments.cn: 但有些人认为，宝宝绝对应该在自己的房间里睡。

segments.en: Okay in another room and in a crib.
segments.cn: 好的，在另一个房间里，在婴儿床上。

segments.en: Yeah.
Right I think this is a very important issue because many people consider that it's a good thing for the baby to sleep with the parents and it feels safe and you can make sure the baby's okay.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一个非常重要的问题，因为很多人认为宝宝和父母一起睡是件好事，这样宝宝会感到安全，你可以确保宝宝没事。

segments.en: And it's easier for you know waking up to feed the baby and change a stiper.
segments.cn: 而且这样更容易在夜里醒来喂宝宝和换尿布。

segments.en: Exactly and well if the baby is sleeping with its parents it might not wake up as much.
segments.cn: 确实如此，如果宝宝和父母一起睡，可能不会那么频繁地醒来。

segments.en: But other people think if you let the baby sleep with the parents the baby will become kind of spoiled and not a very good baby.
segments.cn: 但其他人认为，如果让宝宝和父母一起睡，宝宝可能会变得有些娇惯，不会是个好宝宝。

segments.en: Right it might become too dependent on the parents and for example if you ever want to go out or leave the baby with a babysitter or when the baby starts maybe preschool or kindergarten it might not be really independent.
segments.cn: 对，可能会变得过于依赖父母，比如如果你想外出或把宝宝留给保姆，或者当宝宝开始上学前班或幼儿园时，可能就不会很独立。

segments.en: So why don't you tell us what you think?
segments.cn: 那么你为什么不告诉我们你的想法呢？

segments.en: Do you think it's a good idea to allow a baby to sleep with you or should it sleep in its own room?
segments.cn: 你认为让宝宝和你一起睡是个好主意，还是应该让他在自己的房间里睡？

segments.en: Yeah you can tell us at our website EnglishPod.com where you can also ask any questions you have about the language in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 是的，你可以在我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 告诉我们你的看法，那里你也可以问任何关于这个对话中语言的问题。

segments.en: Alright guys so we'll see you there and until next time.
